componentDescription:
The `TextField` is a convenience wrapper for the most common cases (80%).
It cannot be all things to all people, otherwise the API would grow out of control.

## Advanced Configuration

It's important to understand that the text field is a simple abstraction
on top of the following components:

- [FormControl](/api/form-control/)
- [InputLabel](/api/input-label/)
- [FilledInput](/api/filled-input/)
- [OutlinedInput](/api/outlined-input/)
- [Input](/api/input/)
- [FormHelperText](/api/form-helper-text/)

If you wish to alter the props applied to the `input` element, you can do so as follows:

```jsx
const inputProps = {
  step: 300,
};

return <TextField id="time" type="time" inputProps={inputProps} />;
```

For advanced cases, please look at the source of TextField by clicking on the
"Edit this page" button above. Consider either:

- using the upper case props for passing values directly to the components
- using the underlying components directly as shown in the demos

propDescriptions.autoComplete: This prop helps users to fill forms faster, especially on mobile devices. The name can be confusing, as it's more like an autofill. You can learn more about it following the specification.
propDescriptions.autoFocus: If true, the input element is focused during the first mount.
propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.
propDescriptions.defaultValue: The default input value. Use when the component is not controlled.
propDescriptions.disabled: trueの場合、コンポーネントは無効になります。
propDescriptions.error: If true, the label should be displayed in an error state.
propDescriptions.fullWidth: If true, the input will take up the full width of its container.
propDescriptions.id: The id of the input element. Use this prop to make label and helperText accessible for screen readers.
propDescriptions.InputProps: Props applied to the Input element. It will be a FilledInput, OutlinedInput or Input component depending on the variant prop value.
propDescriptions.inputRef: Pass a ref to the input element.
propDescriptions.label: The label content.
propDescriptions.margin: If dense or normal, will adjust vertical spacing of this and contained components.
propDescriptions.maxRows: Maximum number of rows to display when multiline option is set to true.
propDescriptions.minRows: Minimum number of rows to display when multiline option is set to true.
propDescriptions.multiline: If true, a textarea element is rendered.instead of an input.
propDescriptions.name: Name attribute of the input element.
propDescriptions.onChange:
Callback fired when the value is changed.

Signature:
function(event: object) => void
event: The event source of the callback. You can pull out the new value by accessing event.target.value (string).
propDescriptions.placeholder: The short hint displayed in the input before the user enters a value.
propDescriptions.required: If true, the label is displayed as required and the input element is required.
propDescriptions.rows: Number of rows to display when multiline option is set to true.
propDescriptions.select: Render a Select element while passing the Input element to Select as input parameter. If this option is set you must pass the options of the select as children.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.type: Type of the input element. It should be a valid HTML5 input type.
propDescriptions.value: The value of the input element, required for a controlled component.

root.description: Styles applied to the root element.
